Skip to contents
EnvironmentModules 0.1.0
  • Reference

Function reference

Common Functions

High-level functions for interacting with modules that you will use most of the time

module_avail()
Lists all modules available to be loaded
module_list()
Lists all modules that are currently loaded
module_load()
Loads one or more environment modules
module_purge()
Unloads all modules that are currently loaded
module_swap()
Unloads one module, and loads a second module.
module_unload()
Unloads one or more environment modules

With Functions

withr-style functions that run R code in a certain module environment

with_extra_modules()
Runs some R code with additional modules loaded (in addition to the currently loaded modules), without affecting your current modules.
with_module_install()
Executes a package installation command so that the installed package will be aware of the modules you currently have loaded. This means you can load the package without needing to load that module later, and also that you can load that package now, without restarting your R session.
with_only_modules()
Runs some R code with no modules loaded except for those that you provide, without affecting your current modules.

Advanced Functions

Powerful, but more complex functions you are less likely to need

check_version()
Asserts that the current EnvironmentModules version is above a specified version. Raises an error if it is not.
get_loaded_modules()
Returns a vector of currently loaded environment modules
get_module_code()
Returns the R code that would execute a given module command
get_module_output()
Evaluates a module command, and returns the text output.
get_modulescmd_binary()
Gets the file path to the modulescmd executable
get_version()
Returns the current Environment Modules version which can be used for feature testing
run_modulecmd()
Runs modulecmd with some arguments. The shell is harcoded as "r" because (surprise!) that's the language you are using right now.
